definition: to sell off/to get rid of in a sale
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Keep in mind that Drone Platforms don't supply Assimilators when sold.
sentences.chinese: 時刻記得機械平臺在賣掉得時候不提供同化者。

sentences.english: Son and daughter-indemnities to sell the house.
sentences.chinese: 兒子和媳婦認賠賣掉房子。

sentences.english: Cleaned out the garage and sold 2 old dehumidifiers on eBay.
sentences.chinese: 收拾了車庫，在易趣上賣掉了兩臺舊除溼機。

sentences.english: C-I want to sell my townhouse and get a real home.
sentences.chinese: 我想賣掉我市內的房子，買一棟真正的房子。

sentences.english: The Thieves Guild maintains a network of fences that allow the player to sell their stolen goods.
sentences.chinese: 盜賊工會有一個可以賣掉贓物的銷售網。

sentences.english: You promise yourself that you will sell when the price gets to $20.
sentences.chinese: 你自我許諾在股票價格到達20元時就賣掉它。

sentences.english: Selling my snowboarding gear was a liberating experience.
sentences.chinese: 賣掉我的滑雪裝置是一次解放性的經驗。

sentences.english: The old house with all its beautiful furniture and pictures has been sold.
sentences.chinese: 那間舊屋和它所有的美麗的傢俱和畫都一起被賣掉了。

sentences.english: Hu Xuebing is on his way to the county town. He needs to sell his tofu at the morning market.
sentences.chinese: 胡學兵正趕往縣城，他要在早市上賣掉今天的豆腐。

sentences.english: We couldn't afford to keep our car so we sold it.
sentences.chinese: 我們養不起我們的車，只好賣掉了。

sentences.english: I made a long-distance call to my wife, asking her to sell our house.
sentences.chinese: 我給妻子打了通長途電話，讓她賣掉我們的房子。

sentences.english: The company has sold off a number of loss-making operations and found ways of amalgamating smaller plants.
sentences.chinese: 企業賣掉了虧本的生產線，試圖尋求合併小企業。

sentences.english: He decided to sell the house, all of whose windows face south.
sentences.chinese: 他決定賣掉所有窗戶朝南的那幢房子。

sentences.english: We divested ourselves of all stocks and bonds.
sentences.chinese: 我們賣掉了全部股票和債券。

sentences.english: They want to sell the house, which has only one door.
sentences.chinese: 他們念賣掉那幢只要一扇門的房女。

sentences.english: So they have sold up to half of their catal early.
sentences.chinese: 所以初期他們賣掉了一半的牲畜。

definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to pass on/to resell/to change hands
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to return to one's home country
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
